item.title: About
item.author: beck@frecologic.com (Beck Frydenborg)
item.description: Iâ€™m an environmental consultant specializing in water science and policy in Florida. My main interests are in using data analysis and visualizations to help clients in the private, public, and nonprofit sectors fulfil their missions while protecting water quality and human health. I’ll write about some of that work here. In my spare time I enjoy ultimate frisbee, cycling, gardening, hiking/backpacking, and being bad at photography and pencil drawing. All photographs on this website are ones I took unless they’re good, in which case they are attributed appropriately.

item.title: Projects
item.author: beck@frecologic.com (Beck Frydenborg)
item.description: Antibiotic Resistance and Water Quality Dashboard I developed a Shiny site for the Lipp Lab at the University of Georgia. This site allows the user to examine water quality data collected by Upper Oconee Watershed Network volunteers alongside the antibiotic resistance research conducted by the Lipp Lab under a grant from the CDC.

item.title: Slides
item.author: beck@frecologic.com (Beck Frydenborg)
item.description: Occasionally I give talks at conferences. These are the slides associated with ones I can make public. 2020 Adapting Assessment Tools for a Changing Climate Tue, Feb 25, 2020, University of Florida Water Institute Symposium, Gainesville, FL 2018 Assessment of Best Management Practices Ability to Protect Coastal Dune Lake Health Fri, Oct 20, 2018, Florida Association of Aquatic Biologists Annual Meeting 2018, Marineland, FL Career profile: Water Quality Environmental Consulting Thu, Nov 1, 2018, Florida Water Environment Association FAMU-FSU Chapter Meeting, Tallahassee, FL
